Preview: Knowles Corp, a major supplier of microphones to Apple's iPhone and many other smart devices, on Tuesday released a new chip that will allow battery-powered wireless headphones to respond to Amazon's Alexa voice assistant by saying the assistant's name.
Title: New chip to let headphones respond to Amazon's Alexa by name

Preview: Foxconn, the world's top contract electronics assembler, said it had enough capacity outside China to meet Apple's demand in the American market if the need should arise for the iPhone maker to adjust its production lines due to the U.S.-China trade war.
Title: Foxconn has enough capacity outside China to meet Apple's U.S. demand

Preview: As Federal Reserve policymakers grapple with how to downplay their quarterly "dot plot" projection of interest rates without eliminating it altogether, some are looking at a compromise: delay its release to reduce the chances that analysts treat it as a sneak peek of where Fed policy is heading.
Title: Delay the 'dot plot'? Fed policymakers face communications quandary

Title: Exclusive: Foxconn plans management overhaul as Chairman Gou seeks Taiwan presidency - source

Title: PVH cuts profit forecast as CEO sees retail softness, shares tank

Preview: Apple Inc on Wednesday publicly defended its App Store from mounting criticism over its treatment of rivals in a new blog post detailing its functions and guidelines.
Title: Apple defends App Store amid mounting criticism

Title: Zimbabwe presses exporters, power utility as economic crisis mounts

Preview: A judge in the court-martial of a decorated Navy SEAL charged with war crimes in Iraq said on Wednesday the trial would start at least a few days late as lawyers on both sides grappled over allegations that prosecutors illegally snooped on the defense.
Title: Navy SEAL's murder trial delayed over defense claims of prosecutor misconduct

Preview: Apple Inc said on Wednesday its browser engine Webkit will launch a new technology to track advertising clicks and whether they lead to a product purchase while preserving the privacy of users.
Title: Apple's Webkit to launch new privacy feature for ad tracking

Preview: Apple Inc said https://webkit.org/blog/8943/privacy-preserving-ad-click-attribution-for-the-web on Wednesday its browser engine Webkit will launch a new technology to track advertising clicks and whether they lead to a product purchase while preserving the privacy of users.
Title: UPDATE 1-Apple's Webkit to launch new privacy feature for ad tracking

Preview: A landmark European privacy law is making waves worldwide a year after it came into force, fundamentally changing the way data are handled as Facebook, Apple and Google face increasingly frequent complaints.
Title: Yet to show its teeth, landmark EU privacy law already a global standard

Preview: Britain's competition watchdog said on Wednesday that Apple Inc has committed to be "clearer and more upfront" with iPhone users about battery health and performance, after the regulator looked into consumer concerns on the matter.
Title: Apple more upfront with iPhone users on battery health: UK watchdog

Preview: Argentine markets recovered following an early wobble on Monday as investors grappled with the likely impact of a shock twist in the country's presidential election race after the main populist challenger opted instead to launch a vice presidential bid.
Title: Argentine markets stumble, then recover after election twist

Preview: Global equity markets fell on Monday as a U.S. crackdown on China's Huawei Technologies led chipmaker stocks in Europe and on Wall Street to slide on fears of a widening trade war, while the dollar was steady before fresh insight on the Federal Reserve's interest rates policies this week.
Title: Global stocks slide as worries about Huawei fallout mount

Preview: Apple Face ID parts supplier Lumentum Holdings Inc followed Google on Monday in clamping down on the business it does with Huawei Technologies, after U.S. President Donald Trump imposed a ban on the Chinese firm on national security grounds.
Title: Face ID firm Lumentum follows Google with Huawei ban

Preview: U.S. and European chipmakers fell sharply on Monday amid worries the Huawei Technologies suppliers may suspend shipments to the Chinese firm due to a U.S. crackdown.
Title: Chips are down: Huawei U.S. blacklisting knocks semiconductor stocks

Preview: European stocks recorded broad-based losses on Monday, as a U.S. crackdown on China's Huawei Technologies rekindled concerns about worsening global trade and wilted the continent's trade-exposed tech and auto stocks.
Title: European stocks fall on worries about Huawei fallout

Preview: * Major blow to Huawei's global smartphone ambitions (Adds Lumentum ban, U.S. chipmakers)
Title: UPDATE 3-Face ID firm Lumentum follows Google with Huawei ban

Preview: Shares of Japanese automation machinery makers, construction firms and suppliers to Apple Inc. have borne the brunt of recent selling in the country's stock market after an escalation in U.S.-Sino trade tensions.
Title: U.S.-China trade tensions hit Japanese robot, construction stocks

Preview: An intensifying trade spat is one more headache for Foxconn’s next boss. The Taiwanese iPhone assembler reported a worse-than-expected drop in quarterly earnings on Tuesday, against a backdrop of cooling tech demand. Now it has to deal with straining U.S.-China ties too. Chairman Terry Gou has sought to diversify away from Apple’s phones, in part by scrambling up the value chain. His successor will have to climb faster.
Title: Breakingviews - Trade row adds to headaches for next Foxconn boss

Preview: In the U.S. Supreme Court’s decision Monday in Apple v. Pepper (2019 WL 2078087) – an antitrust class action in which consumers claim Apple is abusing its monopoly power in the market for iPhone apps – Justice Brett Kavanaugh wrote that the court was merely applying its longstanding antitrust precedent from Illinois Brick v. State of Illinois (97 S.Ct. 2061).
Title: More antitrust class actions on the way after Supreme Court’s Apple ruling?

Preview: As global currency markets grapple with a growing number of flash crashes triggered by shutdowns in algorithmic trading systems when volatility spikes, UBS is utilizing machine learning technology to carry on dealing.
Title: UBS looks to machine learning to plug FX liquidity gaps

Preview: A Tesla Inc electric car caught fire in a parking lot in a Hong Kong shopping mall, the Apple Daily newspaper said on Tuesday, but no one was injured in the blaze, whose cause was not immediately known.
Title: Tesla car catches fire in Hong Kong parking lot: media

Preview: A divided U.S. Supreme Court on Monday gave the go-ahead to an antitrust lawsuit accusing Apple Inc of forcing consumers to overpay for iPhone software applications, a decision that could lead to billions of dollars in damages and put at risk the company's lucrative way of selling apps.
Title: In setback for Apple, U.S. Supreme Court lets App Store antitrust suit proceed

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday rolled out a new television-watching app for its devices and some Internet-connected TVs, an effort to gain more revenue from reselling other companies' programming and, later this year, its own original shows.
Title: Apple revamps its TV app ahead of streaming service launch

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday rolled out a new television-watching app for its devices and some Internet-connected TVs, an effort to gain more revenue from reselling other companies' programming and, later this year, its own original shows.
Title: Apple revamps its TV app ahead of streaming service launch

Preview: Foxconn is poised to nominate chip unit boss Liu Young to succeed Terry Gou as chairman in a surprise choice by the iPhone assembler, two people with direct knowledge of the matter said.
Title: Taiwan's Foxconn readies chip boss to succeed Gou as chairman: sources

Preview: A Chinese-Taiwanese group is delaying an up to 80 billion yen ($729.33 million) investment planned as part of a rescue deal for Apple Inc supplier Japan Display as it wants to reassess the target's prospects, the Japanese firm said.
Title: Chinese group to delay bailout funding for Apple supplier Japan Display

Preview: Terry Gou, chairman of Apple supplier Foxconn, will retain a seat on the company's proposed board, a company filing showed on Friday, as he plans to run in Taiwan's 2020 presidential election.
Title: Foxconn's Gou to keep board seat as he bids for Taiwan's presidency

Preview: Terry Gou, chairman of Apple supplier Foxconn, will retain a seat on the company's proposed board, a company filing showed on Friday, as he plans to run in Taiwan's 2020 presidential election.
Title: UPDATE 3-Foxconn's Gou to keep board seat as he bids for Taiwan's presidency

Preview: New environmental regulations in Colorado have chilled investment in the state's oil and gas fields as companies grapple with how local officials will respond to a law giving them more power to restrict energy production.
Title: New Colorado environmental law stalls oil investment

Preview: Japan's Sharp Corp, an Apple Inc supplier, said on Thursday it would not meet its mid-term profit target in the current fiscal year after a shift in focus, and that a U.S.-China trade war is impacting its relationship with clients.
Title: Japan's Sharp to miss mid-term target, laments impact of Sino-U.S. trade

Preview: Brooks Koepka does not sound too concerned about whether he wins the PGA Tour's Byron Nelson tournament this week as long as leaves the Big D for the Big Apple with his game in good shape.
Title: Golf: Koepka uses visit to the Big D to prepare for Big Apple

Preview: Business software maker SAP and Apple are teaming up to help clients develop their own mobile business applications using Apple's machine-learning technology.
Title: Apple teams up with SAP to help clients develop iPhone business apps

Preview: Save-A-Lot Ltd, the U.S. discount grocer owned by private equity firm Onex Corp, is exploring a sale of all or part of itself, as it grapples with increased competition and a swelling debt load, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.
Title: Exclusive: Struggling discount grocer Save-A-Lot to seek buyer or investor - sources

Preview: The chairman of Apple supplier Foxconn said on Monday he wanted Beijing to recognize the existence of Taiwan, as he outlined his plans to be the peacemaker between China, the United States and the self-ruled island Beijing sees as its own.
Title: Foxconn's Gou wants to be peacemaker between U.S., China and Taiwan

Preview: Qatar Airways' return to flying over Syria as its eight-year war dies down is part of its efforts to grapple with a nearly two-year Gulf dispute that has blocked it from using the airspace of many of its neighbors, CEO Akbar al-Baker said on Saturday.
Title: Qatar Airways says return to Syrian airspace part of overcoming Gulf boycott

Preview: Oil plunged Thursday, with U.S. crude dropping almost 3 percent as the market grappled with oversupply fears as increased U.S. sanctions on Iran had more gradual impact than expected and U.S. crude oil inventories rose sharply.
Title: Oil drops nearly 3 percent on oversupply worries

Preview: Qualcomm Inc shares fell about 3.5% on Wednesday as investors got their first look at the bottom line impact of a patent fight settlement with Apple Inc, including a multibillion dollar one-time payment and more modest future patent fees.
Title: Qualcomm hangs on to most Apple gains after earnings report

Title: Apple's upbeat forecast pushes market value back toward $1 trillion

Preview: Far from being a Netflix Inc killer, Apple Inc envisions its forthcoming Apple TV+ streaming service as one that could sit alongside other services that viewers buy, Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook said on Tuesday.

Preview: Apple has old age and experience going for it. The $965 billion firm reported on Tuesday a 5 percent decline in quarterly revenue, but it did better than analysts anticipated. Meanwhile, Alphabet shares tanked even as it posted 17 percent growth in the top line. The Silicon Valley giants are both searching for the next big thing. Lower expectations and generous handouts give Apple more cushion.
Title: Breakingviews - Apple’s old age beats Google’s adolescence

Preview: Apple Inc on Tuesday forecast stronger-than-expected third-quarter revenue and Chief Executive Tim Cook said iPhone sales had started to stabilize in China, a sign that Apple's price cuts there are helping limit sales declines.

Title: Apple accused in U.S. lawsuit of securities fraud over iPhone sales in China

Preview: Apple Inc and Qualcomm Inc on Tuesday opened a complex trial with the iPhone maker using a fried chicken analogy to illustrate its claim the chip company is abusing its market power while Qualcomm alleged a years-long plan by Apple to deprive it of billions in revenue, $13 at a time.
Title: Fried chicken vs $13: Apple, Qualcomm explain claims to jury as trial opens

Preview: Apple and Qualcomm have faced up to their mutual need. The $940 billion smartphone maker and $85 billion mobile-chip firm on Tuesday ended a two-year fight over royalties with a licensing agreement and a cash payment to Qualcomm. Apple can’t risk being stuck with second-rate semiconductors in its devices, and Qualcomm has huge revenue at stake. At first blush, both sides benefit from the truce.
Title: Breakingviews - Apple and Qualcomm face up to mutual need

Preview: Apple Inc attempted to reintroduce itself on Monday as an entertainment and financial services company that also makes iPhones as it launched a streaming television service, a credit card and an online gaming arcade.
Title: Apple spotlights services with TV, gaming and credit card offerings

Preview: Apple Inc brought in Oprah Winfrey, Steven Spielberg, Jennifer Aniston and Jason Momoa to talk up its new television streaming service at a Hollywood-style event on Monday marked by standing ovations, hugs and soaring rhetoric.
Title: Ovations, hugs and soaring speeches as Apple embraces Hollywood

Preview: Warren Buffett on Thursday said he could not predict the success of Apple Inc's new suite of services but was confident the public would benefit as content providers vie for their wallets.
Title: Buffett says Apple content plan hard to predict, touts airline safety

Preview: Split decisions on Tuesday by a U.S. government panel in acrimonious patent disputes between iPhone-maker Apple and chip supplier Qualcomm left their battle lines largely unchanged ahead of a U.S Federal Trade Commission ruling and a major trial next month.
Title: Apple, Qualcomm gird for next phase of patent battle after mixed U.S. rulings

Preview: TBILISI (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Mounting public concern over data privacy is pushing tech giants to change their ways, industry experts said on Tuesday, a day after Apple unveiled a series of new products, stressing their privacy-friendly features.
Title: Public concern over privacy pushes tech industry to change

Preview: Goldman Sachs Group Inc's credit card deal with Apple Inc is the latest move by the Wall Street investment bank to court mass-market consumers, potentially connecting Goldman with hundreds of millions of iPhone users.
Title: Goldman's Apple pairing furthers bank's mass-market ambitions

Preview: Apple’s new credit card is a remarkable thing. Not because of the cash back offered to users – they can get similar deals elsewhere. And not because it’s made of titanium and has no numbers printed on it. The unusual thing is that in order to muscle in on a competitive industry, issuer Goldman Sachs has tossed aside many of the features that make the card business lucrative for banks in the first place.
Title: Breakingviews - Apple Card puts customer first, Goldman second

Preview: Vale SA, the world's largest iron ore miner, is set to report fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday but those results now look like ancient history as the company grapples with fallout from a second deadly dam burst in less than four years.
Title: Vale investors seek clarity two months after Brazil dam burst

Preview: Apple Inc's Apple News+ service will offer content from 300 popular magazines and newspapers for just $10 a month. Unless you are wedded to print, it may be time to consider dumping your subscriptions.
Title: Apple News+, at $10 a month, could deliver more content than multiple subscriptions

Preview: Apple Inc's Apple News+ service will offer content from 300 popular magazines and newspapers for just $10 a month. Unless you are wedded to print, it may be time to consider dumping your subscriptions.
Title: UPDATE 5-Apple News+, at $10 a month, could deliver more content than multiple subscriptions

Preview: Apple Inc attempted to reintroduce itself on Monday as an entertainment and financial services company that also makes iPhones as it launched a streaming television service, a credit card and an online gaming arcade.
Title: UPDATE 8-Apple spotlights services with TV, gaming and credit card offerings

Preview: Apple Inc said on Monday it will launch a credit card with Goldman Sachs Group Inc this summer that can be used to earn cash back on the purchase of Apple products, but analysts suggest its rewards do not stand out among rivals.
Title: Apple to launch a new credit card with Goldman. Are the perks worth it?

Preview: Apple Inc said on Monday it will launch a credit card with Goldman Sachs Group Inc this summer that can be used to earn cash back on the purchase of Apple products, but analysts suggest its rewards do not stand out among rivals.
Title: UPDATE 2-Apple to launch a new credit card with Goldman. Are the perks worth it?

Preview: Apple Inc said on Monday it will launch a credit card with Goldman Sachs Group Inc this summer that will be synched with iPhone users' Apple Wallet and can be used to buy Apple products at a discount.
Title: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Apple partners with Goldman to add a credit card to Wallet

Preview: Apple Inc brought in Oprah Winfrey, Steven Spielberg, Jennifer Aniston and Jason Momoa to talk up its new television streaming service at a Hollywood-style event on Monday marked by standing ovations, hugs and soaring rhetoric.
Title: Ovations, hugs and soaring speeches as Apple embraces Hollywood

Preview: Apple has one big challenge – create new revenue streams – and many less than convincing solutions. Chief Executive Tim Cook unveiled a dizzying array of new subscription services on Monday that cover news, television and gaming. The $880 billion tech firm introduced a credit card too. The offerings ranged from confusing to mildly innovative.
Title: Breakingviews - Apple stretches to take on Netflix, Amex, Disney

Preview: Apple Inc unveiled its Apple TV+ original content streaming service and Apple TV Channels subscription service on Monday without a price tag, making it difficult to evaluate how the new ventures will stack up to Netflix Inc and other competitors.
Title: Apple TV+ joins crowded market for streaming options

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday launched streaming and video game services, looking to tap into 1.4 billion users of its gadgets to counter slowing demand for its iPhones.
Title: Factbox: Apple launches TV app, streaming and gaming service

Preview: Apple Inc unveiled an all new Apple TV app and a streaming service called Apple TV+ at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.
Title: Factbox: Spielberg, Oprah to make shows for Apple's new streaming service

Preview: Apple Inc's new Apple News+ service consolidates popular newspaper and magazine subscriptions, which could appeal more to casual readers suffering from subscription fatigue than long-time fans of specific publications.
Title: Apple News+ is $10 per month. Is it time to dump your New Yorker subscription?

Preview: Apple Inc is expected to finally lift the curtain on Monday on a secretive, years-long effort to build a television and movie offering designed to compete with big media companies and boost digital services revenue as iPhone sales taper.
Title: Apple invites Hollywood to Silicon Valley in TV push

Preview: Ship traffic was halted for a third day on Sunday along a key stretch of the United State's busiest oil port as emergency workers siphoned fuels from the Houston Ship Channel that leaked from a massive fire at a nearby petrochemical storage facility.
Title: Petrochemical leak keeps stretch of Houston port closed a third day

Preview: Kashmiri farmer Yusuf Malik learned that his son Owais, a 22-year old arts student and apple picker, had become an armed militant via a Facebook post.
Title: The making of militants in India's 'paradise on earth'

Preview: Apple chief executive Tim Cook nudged China on Saturday to open up and said the future would depend on global collaboration, as the United States and China remained locked in a bitter trade dispute.
Title: Apple's Cook to China: keep opening for sake of global economy

Preview: Apple Inc is expected to unveil a new video streaming service and a news subscription platform at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.
Title: Factbox - Apple's media ambition: Original shows, news subscription

Preview: Apple Inc is expected to unveil a new video streaming service and a news subscription platform at an event on Monday at its California headquarters.
Title: FACTBOX-Apple's media ambition: Original shows, news subscription

Preview: Australia's largest department store operator Myer will stop selling "unprofitable" Apple Inc products as part of its drive to focus on higher-margin items, Myer Holdings said on Friday.
Title: Australia's Myer department stores to stop selling Apple products

Preview: Apple Inc is expected to launch an ambitious new entertainment and paid digital news service on Monday, as the iPhone maker pushes back against streaming video leader Netflix Inc. But it likely will not feature the New York Times Co.
Title: New York Times CEO warns publishers ahead of Apple news launch

Title: New York Times CEO warns publishers ahead of Apple news launch

Title: US STOCKS-Wall Street rises as Apple, tech shares climb

Title: US STOCKS-Tech powers Wall Street's recovery; banks reel under Fed's dovish stance

Preview: British clothing chain Next forecast a fourth straight fall in annual profit on Thursday as it grapples with the sector's structural shift from physical stores to online.
Title: Store sales weigh on UK's Next, with fourth profit fall in prospect

Preview: Finnish game company Rovio has released an augmented reality game called Angry Birds Isle of Pigs, developed with Swedish game studio Resolution Games for Apple's mobile devices, the Finnish games developer said on Tuesday.
Title: Game maker Rovio ventures into augmented reality with new Angry Birds game

Preview: Netflix Inc, the world's dominant streaming service, will not make its TV shows and movies available through Apple Inc's upcoming video offering, Netflix Chief Executive Reed Hastings said on Monday.
Title: Netflix says it will not join Apple TV service

Preview: Foxconn Technology Group Ltd said on Monday it will complete work on a new factory in Wisconsin to assemble liquid crystal display screens and start production before the end of next year.
Title: Foxconn says Wisconsin factory production to launch by 2020

Preview: Apple Inc, in a surprise move on Monday, launched a new 10.5-inch iPad Air and updated its iPad Mini ahead of a March 25 event where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: Apple unveils new iPad, updates Mini ahead of video streaming launch

Preview: Apple Inc, in a surprise move on Monday, launched a new 10.5-inch iPad Air and updated its iPad Mini ahead of a March 25 event where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Apple unveils new iPad, updates Mini ahead of video streaming launch

Preview: The Apple Watch was able to detect irregular heart pulse rates that could signal the need for further monitoring for a serious heart rhythm problem, according to data from a large study funded by Apple Inc , demonstrating a potential future role for wearable consumer technology in healthcare.
Title: Apple Watch detects irregular heart beat in large U.S. study

Preview: The Apple Watch was able to detect irregular heart pulse rates that could signal the need for further monitoring for a serious heart rhythm problem, according to data from a large study funded by Apple Inc, demonstrating a potential future role for wearable consumer technology in healthcare.
Title: Apple Watch detects irregular heart beat in large U.S. study

Preview: Mobile phone chip supplier Qualcomm Inc on Friday won a legal victory against iPhone maker Apple Inc, with a jury in federal court in San Diego finding that Apple owes Qualcomm about $31 million for infringing three of its patents.
Title: Apple infringed three Qualcomm patents, jury finds

Preview: Apple Inc on Thursday responded to Spotify Technology SA's complaint with EU antitrust regulators, saying the audio streaming service "wants all the benefits of a free app without being free".
Title: Apple says Spotify wants benefits of a free app without being free

Preview: At a dinner party in Kabul's high-security "green zone" in March, a senior European diplomat poured himself a glass of red wine and pulled up a photograph on his iPhone.
Title: Left out of peace talks, U.S. allies reassess Afghan support

Preview: Apple Inc on Thursday responded to Spotify Technology SA's complaint with EU antitrust regulators, saying the audio streaming service "wants all the benefits of a free app without being free".
Title: UPDATE 1-Apple says Spotify wants benefits of a free app without being free

Preview: A U.S. federal judge has issued a preliminary ruling that Qualcomm Inc owes Apple Inc nearly $1 billion in patent royalty rebate payments, though the decision is unlikely to result in Qualcomm writing a check to Apple because of other developments in the dispute.
Title: U.S. judge rules Qualcomm owes Apple nearly $1 billion rebate payment

Preview: Apple Inc on Thursday launched a television advertising campaign promoting its stance on data privacy, seeking to differentiate itself from tech industry rivals such as Alphabet Inc's Google and Facebook Inc that have become the target of regulatory scrutiny over the issue.
Title: Apple touts data privacy in TV ad campaign

Preview: Stunned family members on Thursday prepared to bury the eight victims of a school shooting in Brazil, along with the two attackers who carried out the violence, and grappled to understand why the bloodshed took place.
Title: Brazil city burying eight victims of school attack

Preview: A high share of foreign deposits could be an indicator of money-laundering risks and should be reduced in states that fail to properly monitor them, European Union officials said, as the block grapples with a series of financial scandals at its banks.
Title: EU officials see money-laundering risks from high share of foreign deposits

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. Preview: U.S. stocks jumped on Monday as the technology sector led a broad-based rebound following five straight sessions of losses, but a fall in Boeing's shares limited the Dow's advance after a deadly airline crash in Ethiopia.
Title: Wall Street snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: UPDATE 2-Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: * Indexes rise: Dow 0.8 pct, S&P 500 1.5 pct, Nasdaq 2 pct (Updates to close)
Title: US STOCKS-Wall St snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Rio Tinto is in talks to move into the next phase of an agreement with Apple, Chief Executive Jean-Sebastien Jacques said on Friday, as the miner looks to transition its aluminum business to tap a low-carbon economy.
Title: Rio Tinto talking to Apple on next step of carbon-free aluminum project

Preview: Dialog Semiconductor is targeting new growth opportunities from home healthcare to gaming consoles following a $600 million deal to cut its exposure to Apple, CEO Jalal Bagherli told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Dialog Semi, smaller after Apple deal, targets new growth areas

Preview: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.
Title: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple

Preview: Chinese online retailers have started discounting iPhones for the second time this year as Apple Inc wrestles with a prolonged sales slowdown in the world's largest smartphone market.
Title: Chinese online retailers slash iPhone prices for second time this year

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: UPDATE 2-Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: * Indexes rise: Dow 0.8 pct, S&P 500 1.5 pct, Nasdaq 2 pct (Updates to close)
Title: US STOCKS-Wall St snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Rio Tinto is in talks to move into the next phase of an agreement with Apple, Chief Executive Jean-Sebastien Jacques said on Friday, as the miner looks to transition its aluminum business to tap a low-carbon economy.
Title: Rio Tinto talking to Apple on next step of carbon-free aluminum project

Preview: Dialog Semiconductor is targeting new growth opportunities from home healthcare to gaming consoles following a $600 million deal to cut its exposure to Apple, CEO Jalal Bagherli told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Dialog Semi, smaller after Apple deal, targets new growth areas

Preview: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.
Title: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple

Preview: Chinese online retailers have started discounting iPhones for the second time this year as Apple Inc wrestles with a prolonged sales slowdown in the world's largest smartphone market.
Title: Chinese online retailers slash iPhone prices for second time this year

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: * Indexes rise: Dow 0.8 pct, S&P 500 1.5 pct, Nasdaq 2 pct (Updates to close)
Title: US STOCKS-Wall St snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Rio Tinto is in talks to move into the next phase of an agreement with Apple, Chief Executive Jean-Sebastien Jacques said on Friday, as the miner looks to transition its aluminum business to tap a low-carbon economy.
Title: Rio Tinto talking to Apple on next step of carbon-free aluminum project

Preview: Dialog Semiconductor is targeting new growth opportunities from home healthcare to gaming consoles following a $600 million deal to cut its exposure to Apple, CEO Jalal Bagherli told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Dialog Semi, smaller after Apple deal, targets new growth areas

Preview: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.
Title: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple

Preview: Chinese online retailers have started discounting iPhones for the second time this year as Apple Inc wrestles with a prolonged sales slowdown in the world's largest smartphone market.
Title: Chinese online retailers slash iPhone prices for second time this year

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: Rio Tinto is in talks to move into the next phase of an agreement with Apple, Chief Executive Jean-Sebastien Jacques said on Friday, as the miner looks to transition its aluminum business to tap a low-carbon economy.
Title: Rio Tinto talking to Apple on next step of carbon-free aluminum project

Preview: Dialog Semiconductor is targeting new growth opportunities from home healthcare to gaming consoles following a $600 million deal to cut its exposure to Apple, CEO Jalal Bagherli told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Dialog Semi, smaller after Apple deal, targets new growth areas

Preview: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.
Title: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple

Preview: Chinese online retailers have started discounting iPhones for the second time this year as Apple Inc wrestles with a prolonged sales slowdown in the world's largest smartphone market.
Title: Chinese online retailers slash iPhone prices for second time this year

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: Dialog Semiconductor is targeting new growth opportunities from home healthcare to gaming consoles following a $600 million deal to cut its exposure to Apple, CEO Jalal Bagherli told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Dialog Semi, smaller after Apple deal, targets new growth areas

Preview: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.
Title: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple

Preview: Chinese online retailers have started discounting iPhones for the second time this year as Apple Inc wrestles with a prolonged sales slowdown in the world's largest smartphone market.
Title: Chinese online retailers slash iPhone prices for second time this year

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: U.S. stocks jumped on Monday as the technology sector led a broad-based rebound following five straight sessions of losses, but a fall in Boeing's shares limited the Dow's advance after a deadly airline crash in Ethiopia.
Title: Wall Street snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: UPDATE 2-Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: * Indexes rise: Dow 0.8 pct, S&P 500 1.5 pct, Nasdaq 2 pct (Updates to close)
Title: US STOCKS-Wall St snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Fitbit Inc launched its cheapest smartwatch on Wednesday to defend its position as the second-largest seller of smartwatches after Apple Inc.
Title: Fitbit launches lower-cost fitness devices to combat Samsung, Apple

Preview: Chinese online retailers have started discounting iPhones for the second time this year as Apple Inc wrestles with a prolonged sales slowdown in the world's largest smartphone market.
Title: Chinese online retailers slash iPhone prices for second time this year

Preview: Spotify is pitching its complaint against Apple to a willing European audience. The Swedish music-streaming service has told antitrust regulators that its rival stifles competition. A case may take years. But the Stockholm-based group has adeptly timed its move to coincide with a broader backlash in Europe against U.S. Big Tech.
Title: Breakingviews - Spotify pitches Apple lament to easy EU audience

Preview: Spotify has filed a complaint with EU antitrust regulators against Apple, saying the iPhone maker unfairly limits rivals to its own Apple Music streaming service.
Title: Spotify files EU antitrust complaint against Apple

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: U.S. stocks jumped on Monday as the technology sector led a broad-based rebound following five straight sessions of losses, but a fall in Boeing's shares limited the Dow's advance after a deadly airline crash in Ethiopia.
Title: Wall Street snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Preview: Apple Inc on Monday invited media to a March 25 event at the Steve Jobs Theater on its campus in Cupertino, California, where it is expected to launch a television and video service.
Title: UPDATE 2-Apple says 'it's show time' March 25, TV service announcement expected

Preview: * Indexes rise: Dow 0.8 pct, S&P 500 1.5 pct, Nasdaq 2 pct (Updates to close)
Title: US STOCKS-Wall St snaps five-day losing streak despite Boeing's drop

Title: In rural Nepal, solar irrigation helps keep families together

Preview: Qualcomm Inc on Monday kicks off a patent challenge to Apple Inc, capping off a two-year legal strategy to put pressure on the iPhone maker before a major antitrust lawsuit between the two goes to trial in April.
Title: Qualcomm launches patent challenge to Apple ahead of antitrust case

Preview: Subaru Corp plans to recall around 2.3 million vehicles globally over a brake light problem, in what would be the automaker's biggest-ever recall as it grapples with a series of quality-related issues following rapid expansion.
Title: Japan's Subaru plans biggest-ever global recall over brake lights

Preview: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it planned to lay off 190 employees in its self-driving car program, Project Titan, changes that provide a rare window into the automotive technologies the company has been pursuing.
Title: Apple self-driving car layoffs give hints to division's direction

Preview: Spotify, the world's most popular paid music streaming service, launched in India on Tuesday, stepping into a price-sensitive market crowded by well-funded local players like JioSaavn and Apple Music.
Title: Spotify steps into crowded Indian market

Preview: Generic drugmaker Mylan NV on Tuesday reported lower-than-expected fourth-quarter profit and forecast 2019 earnings well below Wall Street estimates, as it grapples with significant problems at its Morgantown, West Virginia, plant.
Title: Mylan quarterly profit, 2019 forecast miss Wall Street estimates

Preview: Major banks are still not ready for a 'no-deal' Brexit as they grapple with delays in licences for new European Union businesses, staffing problems and snags in redrafting contracts.
Title: Banks losing battle to be no-deal Brexit ready

Preview: Apple Inc supplier AAC Technologies Holdings Inc saw its shares dropped 13 percent on Tuesday after the acoustic component maker said it expected first-quarter net profit to fall as much as 75 percent due to reduced orders.

Preview: A security bug is allowing users to bypass new privacy controls introduced by Facebook-owned messaging service WhatsApp on iPhones this month, the service said on Wednesday after users posted about the problem on social media.
Title: WhatsApp bug lets users bypass new privacy controls

Preview: Qualcomm Inc is urging U.S. trade regulators to reverse a judge's ruling and ban the import of some Apple Inc iPhones in a long-running patent fight between the two companies.
Title: Qualcomm urges U.S. regulators to reverse course and ban some iPhones

Preview: Didi Chuxing will lay off 15 percent of its staff or about 2,000 people this year, a source said, marking the ride-hailing firm's first major cut back as it grapples with regulatory scrutiny and public backlash over the murder of two of its users.
Title: China ride-hailing giant Didi to lay off 15 percent staff this year: source

Preview: Prominent hedge fund managers sold out of Chinese technology stocks and dumped Silicon Valley majors such as Apple Inc and Facebook Inc while global stock markets cratered during the fourth quarter, according to securities filings released on Thursday.
Title: Big hedge funds dumped China stocks, Apple as market tumbled

Preview: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc said it has trimmed its stake in iPhone maker Apple Inc, though none of the selling was Buffett's, and added positions in Canada's Suncor Energy Inc and software company Red Hat Inc.
Title: Berkshire trims Apple stake, adds Suncor and Red Hat, exits Oracle

Preview: Apple Inc said Thursday that it will resume selling older iPhone models in its stores in Germany, where they were banned last year due to a patent infringement ruling.
Title: Apple to ship iPhones with only Qualcomm chips to German stores

Preview: Apple Inc said Thursday that it will resume selling older iPhone models in its stores in Germany, where they were banned last year due to a patent infringement ruling.
Title: UPDATE 2-Apple to ship iPhones with only Qualcomm chips to German stores

Preview: Software pirates have hijacked technology designed by Apple Inc to distribute hacked versions of Spotify, Angry Birds, Pokemon Go, Minecraft and other popular apps on iPhones, Reuters has found.
Title: Software pirates use Apple tech to put hacked apps on iPhones

Preview: Apple Inc said Thursday that it will resume selling older iPhone models in its stores in Germany after they were banned last year, but only with chips from Qualcomm Inc, which is in a global legal battle against the Cupertino company.
Title: Apple to ship iPhones with only Qualcomm chips to German stores

Preview: Japan Display Inc said it expects to post its fifth straight year of net losses, with a late shift to organic light-emitting diode (OLED) screens and slowing iPhone sales costing it orders from Apple Inc, its biggest client.
Title: Apple supplier Japan Display forecasts 5th straight year of losses

Preview: Software pirates have hijacked technology designed by Apple Inc to distribute hacked versions of Spotify, Angry Birds, Pokemon Go, Minecraft and other popular apps on iPhones, Reuters has found.
Title: REFILE-Software pirates use Apple tech to put hacked apps on iPhones

Preview: Apple Inc is targeting an April event to introduce a streaming television service that will likely include subscription TV services from CBS Corp, Viacom Inc and Lions Gate Entertainment Corp's Starz among others as well as its own original content, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Apple aims for April launch of TV service with CBS, Viacom and Starz

Preview: Apple Inc is targeting an April event to introduce a streaming television service that will likely include subscription TV services from CBS Corp, Viacom Inc and Lions Gate Entertainment Corp's Starz among others as well as its own original content, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.
Title: Apple aims for April launch of TV service with CBS, Viacom and Starz

Preview: Apple Inc has sharply increased its efforts to test self-driving cars on public roads but lags far behind market leader Waymo on a key safety metric, according to data released on Wednesday by the California Department of Motor Vehicles.
Title: Apple ramps up self-driving program as Waymo says its tech improves

Preview: The former top corporate lawyer at Apple Inc was criminally charged by the U.S. Department of Justice on Wednesday with insider trading ahead of six of the iPhone maker's quarterly earnings announcements.
Title: U.S. charges former top Apple lawyer with insider trading

Preview: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - A Saudi Arabian government app that allows men in the country to monitor and control their female relatives' travel at the click of a button should be removed from Google and Apple's online stores, a U.S. politician and activists said on Wednesday.
Title: Google, Apple face calls to pull Saudi app allowing men to monitor wives

Preview: The chief executives of Apple Inc, Walmart Inc, IBM Corp and other major companies are joining a Trump administration advisory board that hopes to prepare U.S. workers to deal with job training issues and the worforce shift brought by artificial intelligence and automation, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday.
Title: Apple, Walmart, IBM CEOs join White House advisory panel

Preview: U.S. stocks fell on Thursday, as technology stocks from Apple to chipmakers declined following a weak forecast on smartphone demand, while a sharp drop in Philip Morris's shares after results weighed on the consumer staples sector.
Title: REFILE-US STOCKS-Apple, Philip Morris, chips lead slide on Wall Street

Preview: European utility companies are retrenching in their home markets and looking to unwind debt-financed cross-border mergers deals as increasingly nationalist governments balk at foreign ownership of strategic power supplies.
Title: European utilities retrench as cross-border deals lose appeal

Preview: Shares in Apple Inc and its suppliers fell on Thursday after a raft of analysts read a prediction of softer smartphone sales from Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd as driven chiefly by concern about demand for iPhones.
Title: TSMC's smartphone warning points squarely at Apple: analysts

Preview: * Indexes down: Dow 0.23 pct, S&P 0.58 pct, Nasdaq 0.73 pct (Changes comment, adds details, updates prices)
Title: US STOCKS-Apple, Philip Morris, chip stocks lead Wall Street slide

Preview: An appeal by Apple and Ireland against a European Union ruling for the U.S. firm to pay 13 billion euros ($16 billion) in disputed taxes is likely to be heard before the end of the year, Irish Finance Minister Paschal Donohoe said on Tuesday.
Title: Ireland expects Apple EU tax appeal to be heard before end of year

Preview: * Commission says can close collection case if all dues paid (Adds European Commission statement)
Title: UPDATE 2-Ireland expects Apple EU tax appeal to be heard before end of year

Preview: And everything else, for that matter. Hedge fund investors often end up paying more than double the hedge fund industry's standard fees of 2 percent of assets and 20 percent of investment gains.
